column4: What is the effect of the keyboard shortcut Alt+F7 in X (Or should I say 'X')?
ctrl+alt+f7 switches to tty7
I am not speaking about Ctrl+Alt+F7. Rather, about Alt+F7.
It depends on your window manager
What depends on my window manager?
the function of alt+f7
Ah!
You can map it to do basically whatever you want
Ubuntu?
Well, this may be true. But firstly I am interested in knowing what the effect is in the default Ubuntu 8.04.2 installation.
Try it. I don't think it's mapped by default
Your recipe is not practical. To test every single bit in a computer oneself one would need more than a lifespan. Thus theories have been created. Theories are very practical. Not so your advice.
Ok, the keyboard shortcuts tells you what each & every combination does
system->preferences->keyboard settings
There is no  system->preferences->keyboard settings
With GNOME running?
Ubuntu 8.04.2
System->Preferences->Keyboard Shortcuts
Ah! I found it. Thank you very much for your help.
Certainly. :)
Do the keyboard shortcuts listed in System > Preferences > Keyboard Shortcuts > (Keyboard Shortcuts) > Action apply to all GNOME or to MetaCity or what program did implement them?
